revised_title: Physical and Chemical Dating Methods in Anthropological and Archaeological Research
tldr: The article reviews various physical and chemical dating methods used in anthropology and archaeology, focusing on their applications, limitations, and potential for dating early hominid evolution. It discusses the radiocarbon dating method, uranium disequilibrium series, amino acid racemization, fission track, obsidian hydration, thermoluminescence, electron spin resonance, potassium-argon, and other dating techniques. The article emphasizes the importance of accurate dating methods for understanding human technological and sociological development.
